project_descr: Phase Out of Hydrochlorofluorocarbons in the foam production sector in Egypt

outputs.output_descr:
Under this project, four enterprises in Egypt, namely Cairo Foam, MOG, FRESH and SECC, will phase-out the use of HCFC-141b in its PU insulation foam production. The project includes either replacement of the foam dispensers, or retrofitting
IMPACT OF THE PROJECT ON COUNTRY’S MONTREAL PROTOCOL OBLIGATIONS:
This project eliminates 37, 4 t ODP (340 t HCFC-141b) which will contribute to Egypt’s efforts to fulfill its commitments under the Montreal Protocol and its amendments. Egypt is a Party to the Vienna Convention and the Montreal Protocol. It also ratified the London,Copenhagen and Montreal am
Stage II HPMP project preparation activities were approved for Egypt at the 74th Meeting of the Executive Committee of the Montreal Protocol held in May 2015.
